info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 4:49AM PDT until August 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 900 AM PDT. * At 449 AM PDT, Light to moderate rain persists across the Mojave Preserve and local roadways remain impassable. So the flash flood warning has been extended through 9 am. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cima, Mitchell Caverns, Black Canyon Equestrian Campground, Hole In The Wall Campground and Mid Hills Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
